review.title: okay hotel
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly. The hotel was walking distance to many restaurants. The hotel itself had a cool pop culture vibe downstairs with all the games. The only downside was our room was facing the street so all night we could hear noises all night.
review.positiveRemarks: My husband and I really loved the game room.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise level in the rooms. We could hear cars all night and people yelling.
review.locationRemarks: There were restaurants all around the hotel. It was very close to union square and all the shopping. The art museum was also about a 15 min walk.

review.reviewText: Great hotel with lots of character! Great hang out area for the whole fam!!

review.title: Reasonable hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Good location and nice rooms. Only problem is that the thermostat resets often, changing the set temperature.

review.title: There was someone's hair in the shower
review.reviewText: Not as clean as it should have been. The staff was ok. They were professional, but not friendly. I felt the hotel cost more than it deserved.

review.title: Cute, unique hotel with great staff
review.reviewText: My favorite thing about the hotel was the staff. They made our stay so lovely! I also loved sitting next to the fireplace and having drinks in the lounge area. The room was great - just a little small - but the unique decor was great! The bed was super comfy. NOTE: the bathroom door slides closed which looks cool, but does not provide a lot of privacy :P
review.locationRemarks: It a short walk to union square - but I recommend going to the Crepe place at the end of the block!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great location walking distance to Union Square, China Town and the market. Comfortable room. Lovely and helpful staff. Nice to have coffee bar in lobby.

review.title: Cool hotel
review.reviewText: It's a good hotel well located as it's close to Union square, shopping and restaurants. My room was really large and the flat screen TV is large too (so keeps the guys happy). Only niggle is the room deposit is charged to you credit card ie the money actually comes out of the account and so far it's been 4 days and it's not credited back. It severely hampers your credit card limit!

review.title: Great hotel in awesome location
review.reviewText: Very nice boutique hotel. Great decor and atmosphere,  friendly staff, and in a perfect location walking distance to Union Square shops and amazing restaurants.

We had a great time at the Zeppelin. The decor was fantastic and the staff was great. Our room was very modern and fun. The best part about the hotel is the downstairs game area. Free skeeball, basketball, pool, bingo, and shuffleboard. Would be a great place to hang out with a bunch of friends.

Hotel is a very short walk away from union square (and its shops),  but the rooms are very small and the staff service is quite poor - from the welcome to knowledge & recommendations about the city - especially for the price.

review.title: Great little hip hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Excellent location near Union Sq. Hotel with a cool vibe, great staff and good rooms.

review.title: Comfortable, funky, modern hotel
review.reviewText: Staff friendly and accommodating, great location, convenient valet, and comfortable accommodations equipped with modern media

review.title: Perfect choice
review.reviewText: The Zeppelin was a perfect choice for us. It was near Union Square and within easy walking distance, but not so close that we were in mall-ville. The hotel was recently updated, clean, and had a SCREAMING fast internet connection.

review.title: Honeymoon
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the hotel met our needs. Very hip and cool! The staff was amazing. The room small and cozy. My only wish was that they have a real coffee maker in the room not an esspresso machine. The hotel was in walking distance to everything we needed to get to. We will def stay again.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay in the heart of San Francisco.
Very modern and clean hotel. Walking distance to Chinatown, Union Square and shopping center.

review.title: Good location and good comfort.
review.reviewText:
I like it. Close to everything and comfortable.
The staff is very nice.
Wonderful experience. Very clean hotel. The staff was amazing.

review.title: Hotel service
review.reviewText:
This hotel is over rated. 
The price is too high for very low rated service! Hotel parking fee is $65 per night 
If you add all these fees together, then prepare to pay over $400 per day for minimum service you get
No consideration for pre booked guest from Expedia .

review.title: close to union square very convenient
review.reviewText: easy to get around the city...................I liked the in room expresso.
Nice Hotel  close to everywhere   Employees  really nice    I will go again

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: Standard SF hotel experience. My "junior suite" was tiny but the quality of the room was nice.

review.title: Clean, small room, pricey for its size.
review.reviewText: It is good overall but I would not pay $200 per night for it.  Has no Jacuzzi with small room.

review.title: A funky, interesting hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 4 days for work. Used to corporate chain hotels, it was nice to stay in a boutique hotel with a little more personality for a change. The room was small, but well appointed, which is what matters most to me. It was an easy, pleasant walk to my company's office in the Financial District, and I felt perfectly safe as a woman walking back and forth. It was nice to walk up Grant street on my way there and ogle the window displays of the high-end stores, and there are a number of restaurants around (though to be honest, I just ordered delivery to my room most nights, which was also a super easy process thanks to the text concierge services). My only small gripe is that the hotel is split above the 4th floor, and it can be a bit confusing to figure out how to get to rooms on and above the 5th floor the first time, so you might want to get a bellhop to show you up the first time if they tell you you'll need to take two elevators to get to your room!
review.positiveRemarks: Lots of personality, free water bottle in the room, nicely appointed rooms, and great media/entertainment center.
review.negativeRemarks: Better explanation of how to get to your room if you're on the "other side" above the 4th floor and/or a warning/option to NOT have that type of room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square if you're a tourist/into high-end shopping. Feels safe and busy pretty much all of the time.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText:
Fantastic unique hotel in a great location just off Union Square, centralised in the heart of San Fran. Staff were very helpful , rooms were spotless and had all the necessary essentials.

Bar area just off reception is a cool area to chill and/or get some work done if needed.

Free wifi, no hassle with having to pay, passwords, etc.

All in all, a really good stay here and would certainly recommend it!
review.positiveRemarks: It's unique and funky features set it apart from standard run of the mill hotels. Also really nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a little small, but that can be expected for the building it's located in.
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square
Chinatown 
Market Street for some shopping
Local US diners

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: This place was a fun hotel to stay in the heart of union square. Funky decor and art. Great for a younger crowd

review.title: Close to cable car and union square
review.reviewText: Family time in San Francisco, great hotel. Close to cable car, union square and  restaurant.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Other than one unfriendly receptionist we were happy with the overall experience. Our room had two double beds in it for our 4 family members and it was tiny.
review.negativeRemarks: The friendliness of the reception staff.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk to the shops of Union Square

review.title: Great Location; Cool Vibe
review.reviewText: We liked that the hotel was new, fresh, clean and in a great location.  Great local restaurants were right at your fingertips.  Breakfast at Farm Table and Honey Honey were awesome and walking distance. Union Square is close and I mean close, as well as, the cable cars.  We used the MUNI most of the time and did not use an automobile; you don't need one.  They have these really cool red bikes to use FREE anytime available.  Our room was small but functional and we were not in the room that much. Again, it's new and well thought out....I would not think twice about staying or referring this hotel to our friends.   BEWARE:  Parking is EXPENSIVE; really overpriced I might add. Get your numbers before you use their parking privileges.
review.positiveRemarks: Well, location is everything, isn't it?! It's a new hotel with a cool, modern vibe. Room was small but its all we needed and had everything we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Beware: The price of parking your car is EXPENSIVE per day and hotels lots of hidden charges too.  Know your numbers before you book.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in a great location with Cable cars and Union Square right at your finger tips.  We ate wonderful meals right on Post Street.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed out stay the only thing that would have made it a perfect stay is if it had its own restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is fantastic, rooms are clean and location is perfect
review.locationRemarks: Everything you an imagine right in this neighborhood

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I would stay here again.  Friendly staff, clean rooms and common areas, great location, and especially love the game room downstairs.

review.title: Very cool place to stay. Playroom is awesome.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the stay and location is great.The rooms were nicely appointed and staff was very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance, cool factor and location.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants and bars near by.

review.title: Nice hotel. Located very close to union square.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Located very close to union square. Was yet to be formally opened and  I got a good deal in Expedia compared to other hotels in the area.

Great location, walking distance to everything near Union Square and Market Street. Transportation if needed is accessible. Beds could be more comfortable but its a great hotel for weekend get away. Clean room and staff are super friendly.

review.title: Great location with cool vibe.
review.reviewText: Wasn't sure what to expect but very pleasantly surprised when we got there.  Staff super helpful. Awesome location.  Great, clean rooms.

review.title: Very cool boutique Hotel in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: Great themed boutiquey Hotel. Really like the espresso machine in the room and the unique decor. Very clean and comfortable.  Only complaint was loud banging noises way to early in the morning. Could have been coming from the roof since the room was on the top floor.

We came in to the hotel and was greeted with a friendly face and smile that welcomed us into the hotel and city.  The hotel is in an ideal location.  The basement game area was a great idea and a lot of fun.  It was a little confusing in getting to our room because it was in the adjoining building and needed to go to the 4th floor and then cross over to the other building and then we needed to go up to the 5th floor.  Other than the route to the room, the hotel was great.
review.negativeRemarks: See above to the room location.

review.title: Hip hotel for the younger generation
review.reviewText:
On the upside: Loved the playroom. They have a free ski-ball machine, basket ball hoops with foam balls, a pool table, large screen TVs and comfortable modern chairs, and a shuffle board. Inside the hotel room, we had a huge Smart TV. 

On the downside: it is an old building, and although completely updated, it still has that "old building" smell. Not that bad, but if you're sensitive to smells maybe not the place for you. Also, if you're not tech savvy, you won't be able to figure out how to work the smart TV. 

There are great breakfast options a block away. Lots of night life. Definitely a young person's hotel (think 20-30 year-olds.)
Great time!!! Such a cool vibe in the hotel! Great staff and great service! Centrally located so close to everything!

review.title: Centrally located in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Great location, clean and modern. But echoing from people walking in the corridor, late guest checked in on my last night next door yelling her key did not work then somehoe she tried my room and managed to open my room i was in bed when she open the door... I was in room 433 i was shocked and suprised that the key opened my room.
Beware very expensive parking fees and not many alternative options in the area. The rooms are small and the staff was not particularly friendly, but it was fine for a short stay.
Freshly redesigned, great location. Front desk staff was quiet and didn't acknowledge my Expedia VIP status or amenity.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union square
review.reviewText:
We had both terrible and wonderful experience in this 2 night stay. We were assigned room 723 at check in and had to work the maze to the other side of the hotel via 2 elevators. The room was very small but we figured that is normal for in the city location. However the noise above the room started right away and despite asking the staff to talk to the people above the room the noise continued. When we returned from dinner all was quiet so it seemed everyone upstairs were asleep. Unfortunately at 6:15AM the noise resumed and again we called for help. With the noise relentless I walked upstairs to find we were directly below the fitness center so that explained the continuous noise from above. Now we had to move and the hotel staff was most helpful and sympathetic to our cause. As it was our 32 wedding anniversary we had hoped for a nicer experience and day 2 provided this once the hassle of moving rooms was over. They put us into a very nice spacious suite and even sent us a bottle of champagne for our Anniversary and troubles. 

It goes to show that there can always be problems but how one responds to the issues that makes the difference and this hotel responded in a first class way and converted us into a never again customer to one who recommends this hotel to others. 

I did suggest to the manager when I met him to either close room 723 to avoid future irate clients or offer deep discounts and tell the client up front about the gym upstairs.

review.title: Great hotel in nice area
review.reviewText: Met by doorman and glass of wine upon registering. Beautiful fireplace in lobby, nice size very modern room. Area of numerous restaurants, walking distance to china town , downtown stores, theaters.  I'd come back!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The only complaint was the room size. There was very little room between the desk chair base and the wall, it was very difficult to maneuver around banged my foot on the base several times and the suitcase would not wheel through.
Great stay at hotel Zeppelin. Excellent location close to shops restaurants and public transit.

review.title: Gorgeous retro modern hotel, a hidden gem.
review.reviewText: I was in awe everywhere I went, amazing vibes and will definitely stay again. I hope other hotels take notice.
I found the hotel to be lovely, modern and well appointed. It was a comfortable and relaxing stay and I plan on staying here the next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Good hotel in a great SF area
review.reviewText: Great SF Union Square location, all new hip new look, very clean and good service. Dining room has been replaced with a rec. room so any food you get comes from a outside vendor. The front desk provides good services as needed. The rooms are all new and a bit small but nice and very clean. Parking is just 100 feet away.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Union Square location and a really nice price and really clean hotel
review.negativeRemarks: They should bring back the dining room which is now a rec room, which I did not see anyone using?.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is just 2 blocks away, lots of places to eat, drink, shop or just walk around.

review.title: Hotel Zeppelin
review.reviewText: Newly opened Hotel Zeppelin (formerly the Prescott Hotel) we booked their first week open. They did a soft opening with construction still going on and not all of the amenities available. They were using a new TV/Internet service by "Inn Service" which had technical issues during our stay and we did not have TV until our last 2 days. We moved around to a number of rooms to fix it and actually ended up in a larger room with a king bed at no extra cost.The hotel is done in a 70's theme and a lot of the common space while kitschy was not useful or comfortable and you would have to be into that to appreciate it. There were no food or beverages available although the idea is some type of café/bar area possibly opening up later this spring. Although plenty of stores and restaurants are all around the hotel. Rooms were a little small and sparsely furnished which made it difficult to navigate suitcases/cloths for more than a few days. Overall our stay was OK, great location, staff was nice and pricing was reasonable. Rooms and bathrooms were newly renovated and nice. Our stay there was fine and I would stay there again but would prefer to stay at a chain if comparable in price and location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is excellent. Newly renovated so its very clean. Showers are large walk in with plenty of hot water. Reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: Need some type of dresser in room hard to navigate out of suitcases for more than 3 days. Dedicated printer in lobby. Coffee, snacks in lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Blocks from Union Square it is in the perfect location to access shops, restaurant's, attractions and cable cars.

review.title: Fun Stay
review.reviewText: This was a fun, nice hotel in close proximity to areas worth exploring.

review.title: Great location, very fun and comfy, but ......
review.reviewText:
Was told that I'm the second person to check in on Mar 4th.

Was given room 723. 

My issues were :
- heat/AC fan speed not adjustable
- motion detect light has no stay-on option.
sometimes I like a central overhead lighting than from lamps sitting low on one side of room
- in the bathroom, a hand towel bar is put in front of the light's motion sensor, blocking any motion from the shower stall (luckily the door has translucent panels letting in light from the table lamp)
- shower head can not be adjusted
it is a bit too high for 5' 5" frame to shower without getting the hair all wet too
- coffee making machine has very short power cord, no power outlet higher on the wall to plug the machine in properly
- closet door has no handle stop to avoid hitting the front door
- lastly, more towel bars/racks to hold wet and/or used towels

I would have like to see that there's bath towels choices - I personally prefer those microfiber types which absorbs water quickly and efficiently, and then dries quickly. The terry bath towels provided are very soft, but the threads run very easily, thus making a new towel looking unsightly quickly.

I loved their concierge service. One text to a local number for anything you would ask a live concierge person. My contact was Michelle. She was very efficient and super attentive. And I like the scalp treatment that she has found for me. I really would have liked to thank Michelle in person.
review.positiveRemarks:
- the windows can be opened
- TV is at a right height
- bed is not too soft
- bathroom wall paper
- room decor
review.negativeRemarks:
Bathroom hand towel in front of motion sensor blocks any motion from shower stall
Heat/AC fan speed option
review.locationRemarks: Lots of everything very close by. Ryoko Sushi (just North of Post at the end of the block) is a great place to have good food and music.

photos.caption: Air duct open in the bathroom. Kind of creepy.

review.title: Check if construction is done
review.reviewText:
A lot of construction still going on. Lights in our room and we're going on and off, a lot of workers and debris in the hallway. I would have liked to know that this was going on ahead of time. Other than that, rooms were clean, beds
Were very comfortable and the staff did their best to accommodate us.

review.title: Great hotel, affordable price and Great location!
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel! It is brand new so we were the first once to sleep in the room. Great room size and bathroom. Loved the water pressure. Room had free Evian water, coffee, flat screen TV with Netflix and Wifi. 

Hotel was still undergoing some maintenance but was never loud and it never impacted our stay. 
Would recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, cleanliness, the vibe, the people!
review.negativeRemarks:
Missing minor things like:
No garbage can in washroom
track lighting in the way of basketball
